channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Walls with paintings fallen, 9th February
item.description:
Boards had fallen down a fair few weeks ago probably during the storm

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Margaret's Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrectly set up traffic management, 9th February
item.description:
2 way lights have been set up terribly. Signs blocking footway. No sandbags on signs. When red light sign behind the light head. Missing or incorrectly placed cones. And no permit on display. The list goes on.... If this was any other company the council would be issuing fines but because it's ringway they are allowed to ignore the code of practise apparently. You need to do better.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath continually flooded as the drainage pipe is blicked, 8th February
item.description:
The footpath from Brockhampton by The Dower House to Charlton Abbots has been flooded across one gateway (after the first field) for most of the past 3 years but is getting worse. There is a submerged pipe that should allow water to pass underneath and into a stream but the pipe is blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenhampton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes Cleeve View Road, 8th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Cleeve View Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Large hole in road, 8th February

item.title: Large pothole, 8th February
item.description:
This hole has been reported before, it's been inspected and it's been reported as fixed. But from photos attached, taken this morning, it's very much not fixed. I hope that only one invoice is submitted for this job rather than it being raised as a new job and charged twice. This is not the first time holes have been reported as fixed along this road when they haven't been

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged manhole cover at junction of Hales Road and Rosehill Street, 8th February
item.description:
This is an on going problem and has been reported multiple times over the last few months by multiple residents in the area It is outside of No. 26 Hales Road.There is a really loud banging noise from the damaged manhole cover every time a car drives over it and the noise is getting worse and louder. It is. Very busy road, and as well as cars there are very heavy and large lorries, trucks, buses and tractors using this road. The noise is disturbing everyone who lives at the location, both day and night. When inspected it is clear that the tarmac around the manhole cover is now cracking and sinking and it will eventually collapse causing the road to be closed. Please could this problem be fixed asap. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Hales Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
